0:
--------------------
Text: The Little Iliad (Greek: Ἰλιὰς μικρά , "Ilias mikra"; Latin: "parva Illias" ) is a lost epic of ancient Greek literature.
Triplets:<The Little Iliad
1:
--------------------
Text: Little Iliad:  It was one of the Epic Cycle, that is, the "Trojan" cycle, which told the entire history of the Trojan War in epic verse.
Triplets:<Little Iliad
2:
--------------------
Text: Little Iliad:  The story of the "Little Iliad" comes chronologically after that of the "Aethiopis", and is followed by that of the "Iliou persis" ("Sack of Troy").
Triplets:<Little Iliad
3:
--------------------
Text: Little Iliad:  The "Little Iliad" was variously attributed by ancient writers to Lesches of Pyrrha, Cinaethon of Sparta, Diodorus of Erythrae, Thestorides of Phocaea, or Homer himself (see Cyclic poets).
Triplets:<Lesches
4:
--------------------
Text: Little Iliad:  The poem comprised four books of verse in dactylic hexameter, the heroic meter.
Triplets:<Little Iliad
